g.text: identify which component needs to be
key note these unique key varies to
Bios is also stored in the Firmware Chip
- are a bunch of 1 and 0 that acts like switch to the mother board which component is enabled and disabled
and the motherboard utilizes this method to enable and disable a component based on the firmware chip instruction
The CPU contains billions of logic gates and key components
like the ALU (which does math) and the Control Unit (which handles instruction flow)
more logic gates the faster your computer performs
the Ram acts as a cache for the CPU to store its finished instructions
so that the CPU does not need to repeat the task if it is already existing
The GPU acts like a RAM and CPU combined into a single component that helps your computer run faster
it follows the same concept as RAM and CPU Relationship it was Design to help the CPU and RAM to
reduce Workloads and create a seamless relationship where the heavy task are being processed in the GPU
The Storage is a way to store your data from your computer
Hard Disk - it uses a disk to create and read you data
Solid State Drive ( SSD ) - it stores the electrons in an atomic level and traps
using a special transistors to store your data
The Monitor works in a way that it interacts with the GPU may that
GPU be a component or Integrated in the CPU
GPU processes that request and renders a frame →
Sends the frame to the selected monitor through system video output (HDMI or DisplayPort) using hardware-level addressing →
The monitor’s firmware interprets the signal and manages how the image is displayed (scaling, resolution, etc.) →
It gets painted to your screen
Firmware initializes the GPU and monitor →
Displays basic output (like the POST screen or BIOS UI) →
Uses firmware-level display protocols like VESA BIOS Extensions (VBE) or Graphics Output Protocol (GOP) to render to screen
Note The Monitor Have its own motherboard and firmware chip
The Additional Components Varies Depends if the Motherboard Supports it
Storage Device Varies if it has a Kernel Stored inside as the Kernel it works as a
Gateway for your OS to interact with the other components in the motherboard
Your Operating System is the one who utilizes the resources of your
computer for each component it is the one responsible sending the set of
instructions to the kernel to be processed by the components
and return the response based on the requested workload
